metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1335 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: From Apache Tika versions 1.7 to 1.17, clients could send carefully crafted headers to tika-server that could be used to inject commands into the command line of the server running tika-server. This vulnerability only affects those running tika-server on a server that is open to untrusted clients. The mitigation is to upgrade to Tika 1.18.

criterions.comment: tika: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
